Title: The modal particle in Greek
Abstract: © The Author(s) 2016.Five forms of the modal particle are attested in ancient Greek. This article argues that ?ν is an inherited particle, and that the k-forms were the result of reanalysis of prevocalic οκ and ϵκ(i.e. ϵ?κ was reanalysed as ϵ κ'), supported by the vestiges of an old topicalising/conditional force of the IE particle ∗kwe (which appears elsewhere in Greek as connective τϵ). The attested forms in Greek grew out of ∗kwe in contexts where an adjacent u caused the labiovelar ∗kw > k (West Greek κ? was influenced by indefinite ∗kwa). The form κϵν is a creation of epic diction.
